com.percussion.error
Class PSException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          com.percussion.error.PSException
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSException, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PSAuthenticationFailedException, PSAuthorizationException, PSCacheException, PSCmsException, PSContentConversionException, PSConversionException, PSExtensionException, PSExtensionProcessingException, PSMailException, PSParameterMismatchException, PSRequestValidationException, PSSearchException
public class PSException
extends Exception
implements IPSException

The PSException class is the base class for all internal exceptions. It contains the basic constructors for building a language independent error message from an error code and its expected parameters. All error messages are stored using the format defined in the java.text.MessageFormat class. The message string contains curly braces around parameters, which are 0 based. The error manager provides two utility methods which take advantage of the MessageFormat.format method.

Let's assume we have a message with code 100. It's defined in the error string properties file as: 


    100=param 1={0}, param 2 date={1,date}, param 2 time={1,time}
To populate the message with an integer as the first parameter and the current date as the second parameter, we need to build the following Object array: 

    Object[] args = { new Integer(1), new Date() };
When the message is retrieved from the exception, it will look as follows: 

    param1=1, param 2 date=Jan 6, 1999, param 2 time=4:50 PM
This model is excellent for internationalization as the position of the parameters may change based upon the target language. The exception class also allows the message from a single exception to be retrieved with different locales. This is essential for logging to the server in one locale and displaying the text for a client using a different locale.

To perform customized error message generation, the only method that needs to be overriden is getLocalizedMessage.

Note:As part of of partial i18n, three new constructors are added in which the first parameter is a language string in the syntax [language]-[country]-[variant] In this language, country and variant have the same meaning as in Java, the only difference is that it should all be in lower case. If the exception is instantiated with any of these three constructors, the message string text is looked up from a TMX resource bundle not the java resource bundle. Note for derived classes: the final message is not actually created until a call to one of the get... methods has been made. This allows passing in an Object[] that has not been fully defined in the beginning of the ctor.

Constructor Detail

PSException

public PSException()
Default constructor

PSException

public PSException(String msg)
Constructor that takes the error message

Parameters:
msg - should not be null

PSException

public PSException(int msgCode,
                   Object singleArg)
Construct an exception for messages taking only a single argument.

Parameters:
msgCode - the error string to load
singleArg - the argument to use as the sole argument in the error message. Passing null is equivalent to calling PSException(msgCode, null). If singleArg is an instance of Throwable, then the argument is converted to message with the following format:

[exception Name]: exception text

PSException

public PSException(String language,
                   int msgCode,
                   Object singleArg)
Convenience ctor that calls PSException(language, msgCode, null == singleArg ? null : new Object[] { singleArg }).

PSException

public PSException(int msgCode,
                   Object[] arrayArgs)
Construct an exception for messages taking an array of arguments. Be sure to store the arguments in the correct order in the array, where {0} in the string is array element 0, etc.

Parameters:
msgCode - the error string to load
arrayArgs - the array of arguments to use as the arguments in the error message. May be null. null entries are treated as "".

PSException

public PSException(String language,
                   int msgCode,
                   Object[] arrayArgs)
Construct an exception for messages taking an array of arguments. Be sure to store the arguments in the correct order in the array, where {0} in the string is array element 0, etc.

Parameters:
language - language string, e.g. 'en-us', may be null or empty.
msgCode - the error string to load
arrayArgs - the array of arguments to use as the arguments in the error message. May be null. null entries are treated as "".

public PSException(String message,
                   Throwable e)
Create a chained exception with a specific message

Parameters:
message - message to use in exception. If null then use the localized message from the original exception
e - the original exception, never null

PSException

public PSException(int msgCode,
                   Throwable cause,
                   Object... arrayArgs)
Construct an exception for messages taking an array of arguments. Be sure to store the arguments in the correct order in the array, where {0} in the string is array element 0, etc.

Parameters:
msgCode - the error string to load
cause - the causal exception
arrayArgs - the array of arguments to use as the arguments in the error message. May be null. null entries are treated as "".

PSException

Parameters:
e - the source exception, it may not be null.

setOverridingMessage

public void setOverridingMessage(String overridingMessage)
Specifies the string overriding message returned by the exception. This method should only be used when normal approach to composing message does not work. Such situation can exist, for example, in distributed system if a node receives an exception with error message from other node and does not have access to the message resources to reconstruct the error message. Make sure that locale of overriding message corresponds to the locale normally used to construct the message.

Parameters:
overridingMessage - if not-blank this value will be returned as exception message overriding default message composing behavior. Can be null.
